bestBHT.bht: The religious leaders in this context deny any involvement in the killing of the prophets, claiming innocence if they had lived during that time. Ironically, they fail to see that their actions and character closely resemble those of their forefathers. By building tombs for the prophets, they attempt to show reverence, but their hypocrisy is revealed as they continue to persecute God's messengers. Their true nature ultimately exposes their insincerity and lack of remorse.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: If we had been in the days of our fathers, we should not have been partakers with them in the blood of the prophets.
They were witnesses to themselves that they were the children of them that killed the prophets.
Convicting themselves daily of as exact a resemblance in spirit and character to the very classes over whose deeds they pretended to mourn, as child to parent.
Marvin Vincent: Ye build. Or are building, carrying on the work now. See on Matthew 23:29.
Tombs of the prophets. See on Matthew 23:29.
John Gill: Woe unto you... for ye build the sepulchres of the prophets."
...and your fathers killed them; the prophets.
...both had the same malignant spirit against the faithful servants and messengers of God; and which showed their great hypocrisy.

bhtAttempts.bht: In Luke 11:47, the religious leaders claim that if they had lived in the time of their fathers, they would not have been guilty of killing the prophets. However, they fail to recognize that they are actually following in their forefathers' footsteps by rejecting and persecuting God's messengers. They are blind to the fact that they, too, are complicit in the bloodshed of the prophets. Their actions demonstrate a striking resemblance to the very people they claim to mourn, exposing their hypocrisy. By building tombs for the prophets, they attempt to appear righteous, but their true colors are revealed as they continue to persecute those who bring God's message.

The religious leaders in this passage claim that they would not have been involved in the killing of the prophets if they had lived in their ancestors' time. However, their actions contradict their words, as they convict themselves by demonstrating a close resemblance in spirit to those who killed the prophets. Their hypocrisy is evident as they construct tombs for the prophets while continuing to persecute and reject God's messengers. Such behavior reveals their true character and exposes their insincerity in honoring the prophets.

The religious leaders in this verse claim that they would not have participated in the bloodshed of the prophets if they had lived in their time. However, they fail to acknowledge their own complicity in persecuting God's messengers. Their words hold no weight as they convict themselves by exhibiting the same spirit and character as those who killed the prophets. While they build tombs for the prophets and feign mourning, their actions reveal their true nature and expose their hypocrisy.

The religious leaders in this passage deny their involvement in the killing of the prophets, claiming innocence if they had lived during that time. However, their actions betray their words as they bear a striking resemblance, both in spirit and character, to their forefathers. They are blind to their own hypocrisy as they construct tombs for the prophets while continuing to persecute and reject God's messengers. Their pretense of honoring the prophets unravels when their true nature is exposed, exposing their insincerity.

The religious leaders in this context deny any involvement in the killing of the prophets, claiming innocence if they had lived during that time. Ironically, they fail to see that their actions and character closely resemble those of their forefathers. By building tombs for the prophets, they attempt to show reverence, but their hypocrisy is revealed as they continue to persecute God's messengers. Their true nature ultimately exposes their insincerity and lack of remorse.
